original: Eliasson, Herbert Gustaf Ragnar, läroverksadjunkt, Oskarshamn, f. 6/6/ 02 i Varberg av dir. August E. o. Mathilda Dahlgren. G. 37 m. Lisa Ce-derbom. Barn: Eva f. 38, Inger 41. Stud:ex. i Halmstad 21, fil. mag. i Lund 29, ing:ex. v. CTI 24, provår v. Gbgs h. re al 34. Vik. ämnesiär. v. Lan ds kr. ko mm. flicksk. 29, vik. adj. i Trollhättan 30, 31-32, vik. ämneslär. i Karlskr. 30-31, extralär. v. Hälsingb. flicklärov. 32-33, v. Gbgs östra real 35, v. Vasa h. a. 1. i Gbg 35-40, e. o. adj. 38, timlär. v. Chalmers 1. avd. 34-40, adj. i ma t em., fys. o. kemi v. Oskarshamns samrealsk. 40. Vik. rektor i Trollhättan somr. 32-38, i Oskarshamn somr. 41-45. Ordf. i Gbgs-krets, av Sv:e’S extralär :fören. 36-39, ordf. i 0’S-karsh. ungdomsTåd sed. 42, i O :s idrottsallians’ sed. 46, i Fören. O :s Idrottshall sed. 44. Hobby: tennis.
translated: Eliasson, Herbert Gustaf Ragnar was a high school teacher in Oskarshamn. He was born on June 6, 1902 in Varberg to director August E. and Mathilda Dahlgren. He married Lisa Cedarbom in 1937 and had two children, Eva (born in 1938) and Inger (born in 1941). He passed his final high school exam in Halmstad in 1921, obtained a Master of Philosophy degree in Lund in 1929, and an engineering degree from Chalmers University of Technology in 1924. He also had a teaching position at the Lands krono school for girls in 1929 and at various other schools until his appointment as an assistant teacher in Oskarshamn in 1940. Eliasson served as acting principal in Trollhattan from 1932 to 1938 and in Oskarshamn from 1941 to 1945. Additionally, he held various leadership positions including chairman of the Gothenburg district of the Association of Part-time Teachers from 1936 to 1939, chairman of the Youth Council in Oskarshamn since 1942, chairman of the Oskarshamn Sports Alliance since 1946, and chairman of the Oskarshamn Sports Hall Association since 1944. His hobby was tennis.

structured.name: Herbert Gustaf Ragnar Eliasson

memberOf.name: Gothenburg district of Association of Part-time Teachers

structured.description: Herbert Gustaf Ragnar Eliasson was a high school teacher and prominent member of various educational and sports organizations in Sweden. He was born on June 6, 1902 in Varberg to director August E. and Mathilda Dahlgren. He married Lisa Cedarbom in 1937 and had two children, Eva and Inger. Eliasson obtained a Master of Philosophy degree from Lund University in 1929 and an engineering degree from Chalmers University of Technology in 1924. He held teaching positions at various schools and was appointed as an assistant teacher in Oskarshamn in 1940. Eliasson served as acting principal in Trollhattan from 1932 to 1938 and in Oskarshamn from 1941 to 1945. He also held various leadership positions including chairman of the Gothenburg district of the Association of Part-time Teachers from 1936 to 1939, chairman of the Youth Council in Oskarshamn since 1942, chairman of the Oskarshamn Sports Alliance since 1946, and chairman of the Oskarshamn Sports Hall Association since 1944. Eliasson's hobby was tennis.
